availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Anthony Lockwood Symmes (Louisville, Kentucky, coal agent)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, coal agent. Ohio native. Son of Americus Vespucci Symmes and Mary Milliken Symmes. Married to Mary E. Culver Symmes in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on January 20, 1857. Father of Charles H. Symmes and Ella J. Symmes. Attended school in Butler County, Ohio, in 1850. Attended school at Hanover College in Jefferson County, Indiana, from 1850 to 1851. Coal agent in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Coal agent in Louisville in 1861.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482708.
"Anthony Lockwood Symmes," Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 14645.
The Nineteenth Annual Circular of Hanover College Comprising the Catalogue, Course of Study, &c., (Cincinnati: John D. Thorpe, 1851), p. 11.
